Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style or Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; two faded added white bands and a third one below; exterior: painted decoration consisting of part of sphinx, to left; part of rising roundel as filling ornament.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis) (on the evidence of being included in Petrie 1886, pl. V.)
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as belonging to the Group of Light-Walled Naukratis Animal Chalices. All sherds in this group are small and offer very little by way of information beyond the fact that they come from light-walled chalices. The decoration on sherds belonging to this group is also poorly or carelessly drawn (Lemos 1991, 93). The lack of decoration on the interior surface of the sherd suggests that the sherd may be earlier and belong in the Wild Goat Style.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 93, p. 258, no. 488, pl. 65)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. V, no. 39)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0357) (phase 2)
